Title.En: Ride, game, thrive: indoor cycling revolution

Description.En:
We are Centric – we believe in people. Our commitment to keeping our employees engaged, happy, and healthy is unwavering. This commitment extends beyond our organisation, embracing our social responsibility to contribute meaningfully to education and mentorship. Our participation in this challenge reflects our dedication to fostering learning through innovation and creativity, encouraging students to learn by doing. This initiative draws inspiration from our internal teams, proposing a solution that not only promotes active learning but also prioritises well-being.  
  
Our goal with this challenge is to merge the realms of technology and wellness, creating an opportunity for students to engage in a project with real-world applications and societal impact. We aim to inspire innovative thinking that transcends traditional boundaries, encouraging solutions that keep cycling accessible and exciting year-round. By participating, students will gain valuable skills in technological development and creative problem-solving, all while contributing to healthier lifestyles and environmental sustainability. This challenge is not just an academic exercise; it's a chance to make a tangible difference in how we approach fitness and engagement in the digital age.  
  
By aligning our challenge with these goals, we invite students to be at the forefront of creating meaningful change, benefiting not only themselves through skill acquisition but also society by promoting health and sustainable practices.

NoteLiteral.En: Utilise effective teamwork and leadership principles while collaborating within diverse, interdisciplinary teams.
Innovatively tackle complex real-world issues using the core tenets of challenge-based learning methodology.

PrefLabel.En: evaluate data, information and digital content

NoteLiteral.En: Self-sufficiently pinpoint a unique and impactful research direction, utilizing existing knowledge and acquired competencies.

Title.En: Create and present ideas and prototypes

NoteLiteral.En: Create and effectively present innovative ideas and developed prototypes tailored to the requirements of unique audience.

Title.En: Ride, game, thrive: indoor cycling revolution
Ride, game, thrive: indoor cycling revolution

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
The challenge will be solved in the module "**[Development of Challenge-Based Innovation](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=INNOM010&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)**" (6 ECTS, online meetings – 32 hours, individual and group work – 128 hours). The module follows the challenge-based learning method: engagement, inspiration, investigation, and action.

The module will be delivered **online from October 3 to December 19, 2024**. The scheduled meetings with the teamchers and the peer learners will be held **once a week on Thursdays**: October 3, 10, 17, 24, 31; November 7, 14, 21, 28; December 5, 12, 19. The meetings **start at 15.30 EET and end at 17.00/18.00 EET** (depending on the day). Please note that attendance is mandatory and highly appreciated by your team members. 

The learners are supported by the KTU teamchers (faculty) and the partner company Centric IT Solutions Lithuania. The learner teams are presented with the challenge during the kick-off meeting, they are invited to do an interim presentation on the progress of their project in the middle of the module and the final presentation of the challenge solution at the last meeting of the module. The final grade is passed/failed.
How can you turn a bicycle into a year-round, interactive fitness adventure?

Turning the seasonal pause into a year-round cycling adventure is at the heart of our challenge. Winter no longer means your bicycle gathers dust. With innovative technology and creative minds, we envision a future where bicycles are not just for outdoor adventures but also for enhancing indoor experiences. This challenge seeks bright ideas for technological and software systems that transform a standard bicycle for indoor use, making cycling an engaging, game-like activity regardless of the weather outside.
Participants will embark on creating a system that not only allows a bicycle to be used indoors but also turns pedaling into an interactive, gamified experience. By connecting the bike to a stationary setup, your efforts will bring to life a visual or game-like adventure on screen, where the speed and intensity of pedaling steer the journey. This initiative is not just about innovation; it's a step towards sustainable living and wellness, offering students the chance to make a tangible impact while honing their skills in technology and creativity. Join us in redefining cycling and be part of the movement that keeps the wheels turning, come rain, snow, or shine.
